clinical_study.brief_title: Sedasys Post Approval Study Users Response to System Alarms
clinical_study.official_title: Open-Label Post Approval Study of the SEDASYS System User Response to System Alarms

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the users' responses to the SEDASYS® System alarms during esophagogastroduodenoscopy (EGD) or colonoscopy.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent of documented responses/actions taken in response to SEDASYS System alarms (oxygen desaturation, apnea, hypotension, and bradycardia alarms)
primary_outcome.time_frame: <24 hours, i.e., for duration of study procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: Fraction of users responses/actions to oxygen desaturation, apnea, hypotension, and/or bradycardia alarms deemed sufficient by Endpoint Adjudication Committee (EAC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: assessment of sufficient alarms will be reviewed by EAC after 100, 400, and 866 subjects completed the study

intervention.description: propofol sedation with the SEDASYS System

study_pop.textblock: Male and female subjects 18 years or older scheduled for colonoscopy or EGD

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) I and II
- male and female
- Scheduled for routine colonoscopy or EGD
- ≥18 years of age
- Able to read, speak, and understand English
Exclusion Criteria:
- Physical or psychological condition which would impair trial participation, at the discretion of the PI
- BMI ≥ 35
- Pregnancy or lactation
- Known or suspected hypersensitivity to propofol or fentanyl
- Use of a fentanyl patch
- Allergies to eggs, egg products soybeans or soy products
- Diagnosis of sleep apnea
- Gastroparesis
- Full stomach at the time of procedure
- Participation in any other investigational device or drug study within 30 days of enrollment

clinical_study.keyword: sedation for EGD and colonoscopy procedures
